question.questionText: Sue bought a white wading pool for her grandchildren. She wanted to heat up the water as fast as possible. She thought that if she put plastic sheeting in the bottom of the pool it might heat up the water faster. She had a sheet of yellow plastic and a sheet of dark green plastic. What should Sue do to heat the water as fast as possible? A. Put the yellow sheeting on the bottom of the pool. (B. Put the dark green sheeting on the bottom of the pool.) C. Put no sheeting on the bottom of the pool; leave it white. Explain why you chose that answer.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Darker colors absorb more heat than lighter colors. The dark green sheeting is the darkest color available so she should use the green sheeting.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Why I chose the dark green sheeting was because the darker color absorbs heat.
It is darker and it will probably heat faster.
Because dark green is a dark color like black that way dark green absorbs more heat.
Because if you put dark green, it will absorb the heat from the sun fast, because it is a dark color.
She should use the dark green because it will absorb more heat.
When they put a piece of plastic bag on the bottom it will heat up a little bit.
The darker the color the faster it would heat up.
Because it is dark green and dark colors heat faster than light colors.
The green is almost like black and the darker the sheeting is its color attracts the sun and heats up the pool.
I chose that one because the sun might reflect it back and almost every dark color are the ones who makes it hot.
